title: Define Project Scope and Requirements (Revised)
description:
The project requirements have been revised to include the following: 
1. Analysis of technical debt types: code smells, architectural issues, security vulnerabilities, performance bottlenecks, and design issues.
2. Support for popular programming languages and frameworks in our organization: Java, Python, React, Angular, Node.js with a focus on common ones like Java 8/11, Python 3.x, React 16+, Angular 7+, and Node.js LTS versions.
3. Output formats will include reports, dashboards, code annotations, and integration with issue trackers such as Jira or GitHub Issues.
4. Integration points with existing development tools and processes: CI/CD pipelines, code review tools like GitHub Code Review and GitLab Merge Requests.
5. Target environments: cloud (AWS and Azure) and on-premises solutions.
6. Monitoring of open-source libraries used in projects to identify known vulnerabilities or outdated versions.
7. Provision of remediation strategies for each identified technical debt item.
8. For the 'Define Project Scope and Requirements' task, I recommend assigning it to a project manager who can oversee this process, ensure proper documentation, and coordinate with all teams involved.
9. The RFC is now ready for the 'Implementation' state.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the components, data flow, integration points, and key architectural decisions. Consider factors such as scalability, maintainability, performance, security, and extensibility. The design should also cater to potential future integrations with other tools and services.

title: Develop Code Analysis Module
description: Implement the core functionality to analyze codebases and identify technical debt issues.

title: Implement Technical Debt Quantification
description: Develop algorithms and models to quantify the identified technical debt issues and assign priority scores.

title: Build Recommendation Engine
description: Create a module that suggests strategies and best practices for reducing technical debt based on the analysis results.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and implement a user-friendly interface for interacting with the tool, visualizing results, and configuring settings.

title: Implement Data Storage and Retrieval
description: Set up a database or other storage solution to persist analysis results and project configurations.

title: Establish Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Configure a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deployment of the application.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the application follows best practices for secure coding, data protection, and user authentication.

title: Write Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the tool, including installation instructions, user guides, and API references.

title: Conduct Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Thoroughly test the application, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end testing, to ensure high quality and reliability.
